intro: Xanthisma texanum f. rubrum, commonly known as the Texas red sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically red or purple in color, which is a distinguishing feature of this particular form. Xanthisma texanum f. rubrum thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments.
